page.title: 14HOME LIFE 1 BRAE
page.content: HERE ARE TWO RECIPES OF TRADITIONAL SHETLAND FAYRE Reestit Mutton Make up pickle using coursa salt in water in a kin(strong enough for an egg or a potato to float in.)Cut mutton into pieces,cut slits in the legs and shoulders.Rub salt into meat before putting in pickle.Leave to soak for about three weeks.Take mutton out of pickle and drain,hang above peat fire and let it dry until fairly firm and has a nice smell. Potato soup Take stock from reestit mutton add chopped vegetables(onions,carrots,turnips) Leave for 1 hour,add cut up potatoes and boil until soft.
